The **woolly mammoth**, q, is a monster that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). A woolly mammoth is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivorous "Herbivorous") [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal") with a crushing trunk attack and two powerful tusk attacks that can send a foe flying.

The woolly mammoth is the only eligible [steed](/wiki/Steed "Steed") for a [player giant](/wiki/Giant_\(starting_race\) "Giant (starting race)").

## Generation

In EvilHack, woolly mammoths are only randomly generated in the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm").

## Strategy

The woolly mammoth is the strongest member of the [quadruped](/wiki/Quadruped "Quadruped") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") in both variants by far, and can crush unwary characters in a matter of turns.

A somewhat common strategy for the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") known as "woolly rain" involves using a [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") to generate woolly mammoths, then using them to clear out various monsters, similar to the "[purple rain](/wiki/Purple_rain "Purple rain")" strategy involving purple worms.

## Encyclopedia Entry

The woolly mammoth (Mammuthus primigenius) is a species of mammoth  
that lived during the Pleistocene until its extinction in the  
Holocene epoch. It was one of the last in a line of mammoth species,  
beginning with Mammuthus subplanifrons in the early Pliocene.  
\[ Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia ]

html:
Woolly mammoth

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
q woolly mammoth (No tile)
Difficulty 26
Attacks Head butt 6d6, Hug 1d8, Head butt 6d6 knock-back damage
q woolly mammoth (No tile)
Difficulty 26
Attacks

Head butt 6d6, Hug 1d8, Head butt 6d6 knock-back damage

Base level 24
Base experience 707
Speed 10
Base AC 2
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 4200
Nutritional value 1200
Size Gigantic
Resistances cold
Resistances conveyed None

A woolly mammoth:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 994

The woolly mammoth, q, is a monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. A woolly mammoth is a strong, herbivorous animal with a crushing trunk attack and two powerful tusk attacks that can send a foe flying.

The woolly mammoth is the only eligible steed for a player giant.

Generation

In EvilHack, woolly mammoths are only randomly generated in the Ice Queen's Realm.

Strategy

The woolly mammoth is the strongest member of the quadruped monster class in both variants by far, and can crush unwary characters in a matter of turns.

A somewhat common strategy for the Astral Plane known as "woolly rain" involves using a cursed scroll of genocide to generate woolly mammoths, then using them to clear out various monsters, similar to the "purple rain" strategy involving purple worms.

Encyclopedia Entry

The woolly mammoth (Mammuthus primigenius) is a species of mammoth
that lived during the Pleistocene until its extinction in the
Holocene epoch. It was one of the last in a line of mammoth species,
beginning with Mammuthus subplanifrons in the early Pliocene.
[ Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia ]

The '''woolly mammoth''', {{orange|q}}, is a monster that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. A woolly mammoth is a [[strong]], [[herbivorous]] [[animal]] with a crushing trunk attack and two powerful tusk attacks that can send a foe flying.

The woolly mammoth is the only eligible [[steed]] for a [[Giant (starting race)|player giant]].

==Generation==
In EvilHack, woolly mammoths are only randomly generated in the [[Ice Queen's Realm]].

==Strategy==
The woolly mammoth is the strongest member of the [[quadruped]] [[monster class]] in both variants by far, and can crush unwary characters in a matter of turns.

A somewhat common strategy for the [[Astral Plane]] known as "woolly rain" involves using a [[cursed]] [[scroll of genocide]] to generate woolly mammoths, then using them to clear out various monsters, similar to the "[[purple rain]]" strategy involving purple worms.

==Encyclopedia Entry==

	that lived during the Pleistocene until its extinction in the
	Holocene epoch.  It was one of the last in a line of mammoth species,
	beginning with Mammuthus subplanifrons in the early Pliocene.
		[ Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia ]
